availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Hawkins (Mound City, IL, plasterer and agent of State of OH)

body.p: Pulaski County, Illinois, plasterer and agent. Ohio native. Married to Mary C. Hawkins. Father of Charles J. Hawkins, Mary A. Hawkins, George E. Hawkins, Sarah E. Hawkins, Adelia A. Hawkins, William K. Hawkins, Harriett E. Hawkins, Lucy R. Hawkins, Nelly Hawkins, and Carrie Hawkins. Plasterer in Newport, Kentucky, in 1850. Plasterer in Mound City, Illinois, in 1860. Agent for the State of Ohio in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 57A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Pulaski County, Mound City, p. 362.
KYR-0001-022-0008.
